question: What pathological condition is MK-1602 used for?
ideal_answer: MK-1602 has been assessed in clinical trials for the acute treatment of migraine.

snippets.text: Meanwhile, 1 small-molecule CGRP receptor antagonist (ubrogepant, MK-1602) is currently in phase 3 studies for the acute treatment of migraine.
We applied this strategy for another late-stage clinical program: ubrogepant (MK-1602), a novel oral calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor antagonist for acute treatment of migraine.
Ubrogepant (MK-1602) is a novel, oral, calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor antagonist in clinical development with positive phase III outcomes for acute treatment of migraine.
AIM: The aim of this trial was to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of ubrogepant (MK-1602), a calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor antagonist (CGRP-RA), for the acute treatment of migraine.
A phase IIb randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of ubrogepant for the acute treatment of migraine.
